heading: # Data tables
headingText: The `v-data-table` component is used for displaying tabular data. Features include sorting, searching, pagination, inline-editing, header tooltips, and row selection.

usage.desc: The standard data-table will by default render your data as simple rows.

slots.heading: ### Slots
slots.desc: The `v-data-table` provides a large number of slots for customizing the table. This example showcases some of these slots and what you can do with each. It is important to note some slot (eg: `item`/`body`/`header`) will completely takes over the internal rendering of the component which will require you to re-implement functionalities such as selection and expansion. Some slots will override each other such as: `body` > `item` > `item.<name>` and `header`/`header.<name>`.

select.heading: ### Selectable rows
select.desc: The `show-select` prop will render a checkbox in the default header to toggle all rows, and a checkbox for each default row. You can customize these with the slots `header.data-table-select` and `item.data-table-select` respectively. You can also switch between allowing multiple selected rows at the same time or just one with the `single-select` prop.

expand.heading: ### Expandable rows
expand.desc: The `show-expand` prop will render an expand icon on each default row. You can customize this with the `item.data-table-expand` slot. The position of this slot can be customized by adding a column with `value: 'data-table-expand'` to the headers array. You can also switch between allowing multiple expanded rows at the same time or just one with the `single-expand` prop. The expanded rows are available on the synced prop `expanded.sync`

group.heading: ### Grouped rows
group.desc: Using the `group-by` and `group-desc` props you can group rows on an item property. The `show-group-by` prop will show a group button in the default header.

dense.heading: ### Dense
dense.desc: Using the `dense` prop you are able to give your data tables an alternate style.

loading.heading: ### Loading state
loading.desc: You can use the `loading` prop to indicate that data in the table is currently loading. If there is no data in the table, a loading message will also be displayed. This message can be customized using the `loading-text` prop or the `loading` slot.

headers.heading: ### Slot: items and headers
headers.desc: The `items` and `headers` slots can accept either a collection of <kbd>td/th</kbd> tags, or if you want control of the entire row, a <kbd>tr</kbd> tag. In the latter case, you have to manually specify a `key` on the row regardless of the `item-key` value.

footer-props.heading: ### Footer props
footer-props.desc: The `v-data-table` renders a default footer using the `v-data-footer` component. You can pass props to this component using `footer-props`.

multi-sort.heading: ### Sort on multiple columns
multi-sort.desc: Using the `multi-sort` prop will enable you to sort on multiple columns at the same time. When enabled, you can pass arrays to both `sort-by` and `sort-desc` to programmatically control the sorting, instead of single values.

customize-header.heading: ### Customizing default header
customize-header.desc: You can use the dynamic slots `header.<name>` to customize only certain columns. `<name>` is the name of the `value` property in the corresponding header item sent to `headers`.

customize-rows.heading: ### Customizing default rows
customize-rows.desc: You can use the dynamic slots `item.<name>` to customize only certain columns. `<name>` is the name of the `value` property in the corresponding header item sent to `headers`. So to customize the calories column we're using the `item.calories` slot.

progress.heading: ### Slot: progress
progress.desc: There is also a `progress` slot for when you want to customize the display for the data table's `loading` state.  By default this is an `indeterminate` `v-progress-linear`

search.heading: ### Search
search.desc: The data table exposes a `search` prop that allows you to filter your data.

paginate.heading: ### External pagination
paginate.desc: Pagination can be controlled externally by using the individual props, or by using the `options` prop. Remember that you must apply the `.sync` modifier.

sort.heading: ### External sorting
sort.desc: Sorting can also be controlled externally by using the individual props, or by using the the `options` prop. Remember that you must apply the `.sync` modifier.

server.heading: ### Paginate and sort server-side
server.desc: If you're loading data already paginated and sorted from a backend, you can use the `server-items-length` prop. Defining this prop will disable the built-in sorting and pagination, and you will instead need to use the available events (`update:page`, `update:sortBy`, `update:options`, etc) to know when to request new pages from your backend. Use the `loading` prop to display a progress bar while fetching data.

headerless.heading: ### Remove default header and footer
headerless.desc: You can apply the `hide-default-header` and `hide-default-footer` props to remove the default header and footer respectively.

edit-dialog.heading: ### Content Editing
edit-dialog.desc: The `v-edit-dialog` component can be used for editing data directly within a `v-data-table`. You can block the closing of the `v-edit-dialog` when clicked outside by adding the **persistent** prop.

crud.heading: ### CRUD Actions
crud.desc: `v-data-table` with CRUD actions using a `v-dialog` component for editing each row

virtualized.heading: ### Virtualized rows
virtualized.desc: Using the `virtual-rows` prop will virtualize the rendering of the rows, which can increase the performance of the data-table when you have a large number of rows. Be aware that you can not use the `body`, `body.prepend` or `body.append` slots with this prop.

custom-filter.heading: ### Custom filtering
custom-filter.desc: You can override the default filtering used with `search` prop by supplying a function to the `custom-filter` prop. If you need to customize the filtering of a specific column, you can supply a function to the `filter` property on header items. The signature is `(value: any, search: string | null, item: any) => boolean`. This function will always be run even if `search` prop has not been provided. Thus you need to make sure to exit early with a value of `true` if filter should not be applied.

filterable-columns.heading: ### Filterable columns
filterable-columns.desc: You can easily disable specific columns from being included when searching through table rows by setting the property `filterable` to false on the header item(s). In the example below the dessert name column is no longer searchable.

simple-checkbox.heading: ### Simple Checkbox
simple-checkbox.desc: When wanting to use a checkbox component inside of a slot template in your data tables, use the `v-simple-checkbox` component rather than the `v-checkbox` component. The `v-simple-checkbox` component is used internally and will respect header alignment.

v-edit-dialog.cancelText: Sets the default text for the cancel button when using the **large** prop
v-edit-dialog.large: Attaches a submit and cancel button to the dialog
v-edit-dialog.saveText: Sets the default text for the save button when using the **large** prop

v-data-table.calculateWidths: Enables calculation of column widths. `widths` property will be available in select scoped slots
v-data-table.caption: Set the caption (using `<caption>`)
v-data-table.expandIcon: Icon used for expand toggle button.
v-data-table.fixedHeader: Fixed header to top of table. **NOTE:** Does not work in IE11
v-data-table.headerProps: Pass props to the default header. See 'v-data-table-header' API for more information
v-data-table.headers: An array of objects that each describe a header column. See the example below for a definition of all properties
v-data-table.headersLength: Can be used in combination with `hide-default-header` to specify the number of columns in the table to allow expansion rows and loading bar to function properly
v-data-table.height: Set an explicit height of table
v-data-table.mobileBreakpoint: Used to set when to toggle between regular table and mobile view
v-data-table.showSelect: Shows the select checkboxes in both the header and rows (if using default rows)
v-data-table.showExpand: Shows the expand toggle in default rows
v-data-table.showGroupBy: Shows the group by toggle in the header and enables grouped rows
v-data-table.virtualRows: Virtualizes the rendering of rows. Be aware that you can not use the `body`, `body.prepend` or `body.append` slots with this prop.

v-simple-checkbox.indeterminate: Sets an indeterminate state for the simple checkbox.
v-simple-checkbox.indeterminateIcon: The icon used when in an indeterminate state.
v-simple-checkbox.value: A boolean value that represents whether the simple checkbox is checked.

v-data-table.body: Slot to replace the default table `<tbody>`
v-data-table.body.append: Appends elements to the end of the default table `<tbody>`
v-data-table.body.prepend: Prepends elements to the start of the default table `<tbody>`
v-data-table.footer: Slot to add a custom footer
v-data-table.footer.page-text: Slot to customize footer page text
v-data-table.group: Slot to replace the default rendering of grouped rows
v-data-table.group.header: Slot to customize the default rendering of group headers
v-data-table.group.summary: Slot to customize the default rendering of group summaries
v-data-table.heading: Slot to add a custom header
v-data-table.header.<name>: Slot to customize a specific header column
v-data-table.header.data-table-select: Slot to replace the default `v-simple-checkbox` in header
v-data-table.item: Slot to replace the default rendering of a row
v-data-table.item.data-table-select: Slot to replace the default `v-simple-checkbox` used when selecting rows
v-data-table.item.data-table-expand: Slot to replace the default `v-icon` used when expanding rows
v-data-table.item.<name>: Slot to customize a specific column
v-data-table.loading: Defines content for when `loading` is true and no items are provided
v-data-table.no-data: Defines content for when no items are provided
v-data-table.no-results: Defines content for when `search` is provided but no results are found
v-data-table.progress: Slot to replace the default `<v-progress-linear>` component
v-data-table.top: Slot to add content above the table

v-edit-dialog.input: Slot used to denote input component for v-edit-dialog

v-edit-dialog.close: Emits when edit-dialog close button is pressed
v-edit-dialog.save: Emits when edit-dialog save button is pressed

v-data-table.click:row: Emits when a table row is clicked. The item for the row is included. **NOTE:** will not emit when table rows are defined through a slot such as `item` or `body`.

v-simple-checkbox.click: Event that is emitted when the component is clicked
